abstract: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
snippet: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google  and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.

headline.main: Pursuit of Yahoo Shows Microsoft Needs a Franchise
headline.print_headline: Pursuing Yahoo Again, Microsoft Shows Need for a Web Franchise

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Steve Lohr

abstract: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google – and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft made clear on Sunday that it still needed to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google – and that its interest in Yahoo had not waned.

abstract: Yahoo wants Google’s cash now and Microsoft’s share of the search business for the long run. It might be well served to do deals with both of them.
snippet: Yahoo wants Google’s cash now and Microsoft’s share of the search business for the long run. It might be well served to do deals with both of them.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo might well be able to have its Google cake and eat Microsoft’s market share, too.

headline.main: Google or Microsoft: Yahoo Should Pick Both
